data.title: Maria Amalia (Borbone) de Bourbon-Siciles (1782-1866)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Marie-Amélie (Borbone) de Bourbon-Siciles born 1782 Caserta, Campania, Regno di Napoli died 1866 Claremont House, Esher, Surrey, England including ancestors + descendants + 1 photos + mitochondrial DNA + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Maria Amalia (Marie-Amélie) "reine des Français" de Bourbon-Siciles formerly Borbone aka di Borbone, Borbone-Napoli

Born 26 Apr 1782 in Caserta, Campania, Regno di Napoli

Ancestors

Wife of Louis-Philippe (Orléans) d'Orléans — married 25 Nov 1809 (to 1850) in Palermo, Sicily Italy

Descendants

Died 24 Mar 1866 at age 83 in Claremont House, Esher, Surrey, England

Profile last modified 1 Sep 2023 | Created 28 Sep 2014

This page has been accessed 994 times.

Biography

Marie-Amélie (Borbone) de Bourbon-Siciles is Notable.

Maria Amalia di Borbone was a Sicilian princess of the house of Bourbon, daughter of Ferdinando, King of Naples and later King of Sicily, and Maria Carolina of Austria. After her marriage to Louis-Philippe d'Orléans she became Duchess of Chartres, later Duchess of Orléans, and from 1830 to 1848 was Queen of the French.

After the revolution of 1848 she went into exile in Clarement, Surrey, where she died in 1866.

She and Louis-Philippe had 10 children including:

Ferdinand Philippe, duke of Orléans

Louise Marie, Queen of the Belgians

Marie, duchess of Wurttemberg

Louis, duke of Nemours

Clémentine

François, prince of Joinville

Henri, duke of Aumale

Antoine, duke of Montpensier, infant of Spain.

1782 apr 26 born[citation needed]

1866 mar 24 passed away[citation needed]

Sources

Wikipedia:Maria_Amalia_of_Naples_and_Sicily

Marie Amelie Therese on Find A Grave: Memorial #12292 Retrieved Sälgö-1 04:09, 6 October 2016 (EDT).
